required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Randomized Study Comparing the Efficacy and Safety of Varenicline Tartrate to Placebo in Smoking Cessation When Subjects Are Allowed to Set Their Own Quit Date
clinical_study.official_title: A Phase 4, Prospective, Multi-National, Randomized, Double-Blind, Placebo-Controlled Study To Evaluate Smoking Cessation With Varenicline Tartrate Compared With Placebo In The Setting Of Patient Self-Selected (Flexible) Quit Date

brief_summary.textblock: The hypothesis is that varenicline will be effective (compared with placebo) for smoking cessation when subjects are allowed to set their own quit date within the first 5 weeks of treatment.

primary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Participants With 4-week Continuous Abstinence (CA)
primary_outcome.description: The percentage of participants who reported complete abstinence from cigarette smoking and other nicotine use (on the Nicotine Use Inventory) and who did not have carbon monoxide (CO) >10 parts per million (ppm) at any visits Week 9 through Week 12. A participant was considered a responder if they met the following criterion: said they had not smoked or used nicotine products 'since the last visit' and did not have CO >10 ppm.

secondary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Participants With Continuous Abstinence (CA) From Smoking Weeks 9-24
secondary_outcome.description: Percentage of participants with CA from cigarette smoking and other nicotine-containing (treatment phase) or tobacco (non-treatment phase) products use, who did not have CO >10 ppm at any visits Week 9 through Week 24. A participant was considered a responder if they met the following criterion: said they had not smoked or used nicotine products 'since the last visit' and did not have CO >10 ppm.

secondary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Participants With Long Term Quit Through Week 24
secondary_outcome.description: Responder for the primary endpoint of CA from Week 9 through Week 12 and who had no more than 6 days of smoking during the non-treatment phase of the study. For Weeks 13, 16, 20, and 24, long term quit was determined by CO-confirmed in-clinic visit.

secondary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Participants With 7-day Point Prevalence of Nonsmoking (Smoking Cessation)
secondary_outcome.description: Percentage of participants with complete abstinence from cigarette smoking or other nicotine-containing (treatment phase) or tobacco (non-treatment phase) products use for the 7 days prior to Week 12 and Week 24, respectively, who did not have CO >10 ppm at any visits. CO-confirmed in-clinic visit.

secondary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Participants With 4-week Point Prevalence of Nonsmoking
secondary_outcome.description: Percentage of participants with complete abstinence from cigarette smoking or use of tobacco products for the 4 weeks prior to Week 24 who did not have CO >10 ppm at any visits.

other_outcome.measure: Change From Baseline in Fagerstr√∂m Test for Nicotine Dependence (FTND) to Day of First Quit Attempt (FQA) Through Week 5 by Smoking Status at Weeks 9-12
other_outcome.description: Change in nicotine dependence from baseline to the date of the FQA within the first 5 weeks. FTND was designed to provide an ordinal measure of nicotine dependence related to cigarette smoking. It contains items that evaluate the quantity of cigarette consumption, the compulsion to use, and dependence. The FTND contains 4 yes-no and 2 multiple choice questions and can be used in a self-report format. The items on FTND are scored 0 to 3 for multiple choice items, the items are summed to yield a total score of 0-10 (0=minimum nicotine dependence; 10=maximum nicotine dependence).

intervention.description: placebo tablet taken orally twice daily for 12 weeks
varenicline tablets, 1 mg taken orally twice daily for 12 weeks

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Men and women
- 18 to 75 yrs old
- Motivated to stop smoking
- Smoke at least 10 cigarettes/day
Exclusion Criteria:
- Active psychiatric disease
- Severe or unstable cardiovascular or pulmonary disease
- Current or recent treatment to stop smoking
- Previous use of varenicline

link.description: To obtain contact information for a study center near you, click here.

group.title: Varenicline
group.description: Varenicline 0.5 milligrams (mg) administered once daily (QD) for the first 3 days followed by 0.5 mg varenicline twice daily (BID) for the next 4 days, then 1 mg varenicline BID for the remaining 11 weeks (treatment phase). Blinded study drug was discontinued at the Week 12 visit and was followed by a non-treatment phase to Week 24.

participants_list.participants: Completed refers to completion of the study.

group.title: Varenicline
group.description: Varenicline 0.5 mg administered QD for the first 3 days followed by 0.5 mg varenicline BID for the next 4 days, then 1 mg varenicline BID for the remaining 11 weeks (treatment phase). Blinded study drug was discontinued at the Week 12 visit and was followed by a non-treatment phase to Week 24.

outcome.title: Percentage of Participants With 4-week Continuous Abstinence (CA)
outcome.description: The percentage of participants who reported complete abstinence from cigarette smoking and other nicotine use (on the Nicotine Use Inventory) and who did not have carbon monoxide (CO) >10 parts per million (ppm) at any visits Week 9 through Week 12. A participant was considered a responder if they met the following criterion: said they had not smoked or used nicotine products ‚Äòsince the last visit‚Äô and did not have CO >10 ppm.
outcome.population: Full analysis set (FAS): took at least 1 dose, including partial doses, of randomized study drug. Missing CO measurements imputed as =<10 ppm. Missing visit(s) imputed based on next available visit. Subjects who discontinued study and were lost to follow up were assumed smokers. Missing data not imputed from other weekly interview questions.

group.title: Varenicline
group.description: Varenicline 0.5 mg administered QD for the first 3 days followed by 0.5 mg varenicline BID for the next 4 days, then 1 mg varenicline BID for the remaining 11 weeks (treatment phase). Blinded study drug was discontinued at the Week 12 visit and was followed by a non-treatment phase to Week 24.

measure.title: Percentage of Participants With 4-week Continuous Abstinence (CA)
measure.description: The percentage of participants who reported complete abstinence from cigarette smoking and other nicotine use (on the Nicotine Use Inventory) and who did not have carbon monoxide (CO) >10 parts per million (ppm) at any visits Week 9 through Week 12. A participant was considered a responder if they met the following criterion: said they had not smoked or used nicotine products ‚Äòsince the last visit‚Äô and did not have CO >10 ppm.
measure.population: Full analysis set (FAS): took at least 1 dose, including partial doses, of randomized study drug. Missing CO measurements imputed as =<10 ppm. Missing visit(s) imputed based on next available visit. Subjects who discontinued study and were lost to follow up were assumed smokers. Missing data not imputed from other weekly interview questions.

analysis.groups_desc: Sample size to be based on a continuity-corrected Chi-square 2-sided test with a 0.05 significance level and a 3:1 randomization ratio of Varenicline to placebo. 652 subjects to provide >=90% power to detect Varenicline versus placebo differences in primary and key secondary efficacy endpoints (assuming placebo CA rates of 0.24 [Weeks 9-12] and 0.18 [Weeks 9-24] and Varenicline CA rates of 0.46 [Weeks 9-12] and 0.31 [Weeks 9-24]) (odds ratio of >=2.67 [Weeks 9-12] and >=2.10 [Weeks 9-24]).
analysis.p_value_desc: To preserve the type I family-wise error rate of 0.05, a step-down procedure to be used for the analysis of CA for Week 9 through Week 12 and the CA for Week 9 through Week 24.
analysis.method_desc: Model to include the main effects of treatment and pooled center.

outcome.title: Percentage of Participants With Continuous Abstinence (CA) From Smoking Weeks 9-24
outcome.description: Percentage of participants with CA from cigarette smoking and other nicotine-containing (treatment phase) or tobacco (non-treatment phase) products use, who did not have CO >10 ppm at any visits Week 9 through Week 24. A participant was considered a responder if they met the following criterion: said they had not smoked or used nicotine products ‚Äòsince the last visit‚Äô and did not have CO >10 ppm.
outcome.population: FAS. Missing CO measurements imputed as =<10 ppm. Missing visit(s) imputed based on next available visit. Subjects who discontinued study and were lost to follow up were assumed smokers. Missing data not imputed from other weekly interview questions.

group.title: Varenicline
group.description: Varenicline 0.5 mg administered QD for the first 3 days followed by 0.5 mg varenicline BID for the next 4 days, then 1 mg varenicline BID for the remaining 11 weeks (treatment phase). Blinded study drug was discontinued at the Week 12 visit and was followed by a non-treatment phase to Week 24.

measure.title: Percentage of Participants With Continuous Abstinence (CA) From Smoking Weeks 9-24
measure.description: Percentage of participants with CA from cigarette smoking and other nicotine-containing (treatment phase) or tobacco (non-treatment phase) products use, who did not have CO >10 ppm at any visits Week 9 through Week 24. A participant was considered a responder if they met the following criterion: said they had not smoked or used nicotine products ‚Äòsince the last visit‚Äô and did not have CO >10 ppm.
measure.population: FAS. Missing CO measurements imputed as =<10 ppm. Missing visit(s) imputed based on next available visit. Subjects who discontinued study and were lost to follow up were assumed smokers. Missing data not imputed from other weekly interview questions.

analysis.groups_desc: Sample size to be based on a continuity-corrected Chi-square 2-sided test with a 0.05 significance level and a 3:1 randomization ratio of Varenicline to placebo. 652 subjects to provide >=90% power to detect Varenicline versus placebo differences in primary and key secondary efficacy endpoints (assuming placebo CA rates of 0.24 [Weeks 9-12] and 0.18 [Weeks 9-24] and Varenicline CA rates of 0.46 [Weeks 9-12] and 0.31 [Weeks 9-24]) (odds ratio of >=2.67 [Weeks 9-12] and >=2.10 [Weeks 9-24]).
analysis.p_value_desc: To preserve the type I family-wise error rate of 0.05, a step-down procedure to be used for the analysis of CA for Week 9 through Week 12 and the CA for Week 9 through Week 24.
analysis.method_desc: Model to include the main effects of treatment and pooled center.

outcome.title: Percentage of Participants With Long Term Quit Through Week 24
outcome.description: Responder for the primary endpoint of CA from Week 9 through Week 12 and who had no more than 6 days of smoking during the non-treatment phase of the study. For Weeks 13, 16, 20, and 24, long term quit was determined by CO-confirmed in-clinic visit.
outcome.population: FAS. If the number of days smoked was missing for a subject visit, the CA responder status of the subject at that visit determined the imputation.

group.title: Varenicline
group.description: Varenicline 0.5 mg administered QD for the first 3 days followed by 0.5 mg varenicline BID for the next 4 days, then 1 mg varenicline BID for the remaining 11 weeks (treatment phase). Blinded study drug was discontinued at the Week 12 visit and was followed by a non-treatment phase to Week 24.

measure.title: Percentage of Participants With Long Term Quit Through Week 24
measure.description: Responder for the primary endpoint of CA from Week 9 through Week 12 and who had no more than 6 days of smoking during the non-treatment phase of the study. For Weeks 13, 16, 20, and 24, long term quit was determined by CO-confirmed in-clinic visit.
measure.population: FAS. If the number of days smoked was missing for a subject visit, the CA responder status of the subject at that visit determined the imputation.

analysis.groups_desc: Statistical testing to be 2-sided and use a 0.05 level of significance. Confidence intervals to have a 95% confidence level. Statistical significance to be declared unless a p-value >0.05 was obtained.
analysis.p_value_desc: A 0.05 level of significance without adjustment for multiplicity.
analysis.method_desc: Model to include the main effects of treatment and pooled center.

outcome.title: Percentage of Participants With 7-day Point Prevalence of Nonsmoking (Smoking Cessation)
outcome.description: Percentage of participants with complete abstinence from cigarette smoking or other nicotine-containing (treatment phase) or tobacco (non-treatment phase) products use for the 7 days prior to Week 12 and Week 24, respectively, who did not have CO >10 ppm at any visits. CO-confirmed in-clinic visit.
outcome.population: FAS. Missing weekly interview questions of whether the subject had "smoked in the last 7 days" were not imputed; missing CO was imputed as =<10 ppm.

group.title: Varenicline
group.description: Varenicline 0.5 mg administered QD for the first 3 days followed by 0.5 mg varenicline BID for the next 4 days, then 1 mg varenicline BID for the remaining 11 weeks (treatment phase). Blinded study drug was discontinued at the Week 12 visit and was followed by a non-treatment phase to Week 24.

measure.title: Percentage of Participants With 7-day Point Prevalence of Nonsmoking (Smoking Cessation)
measure.description: Percentage of participants with complete abstinence from cigarette smoking or other nicotine-containing (treatment phase) or tobacco (non-treatment phase) products use for the 7 days prior to Week 12 and Week 24, respectively, who did not have CO >10 ppm at any visits. CO-confirmed in-clinic visit.
measure.population: FAS. Missing weekly interview questions of whether the subject had "smoked in the last 7 days" were not imputed; missing CO was imputed as =<10 ppm.

analysis.groups_desc: Week 12. Statistical testing to be 2-sided and use a 0.05 level of significance. Confidence intervals to have a 95% confidence level. Statistical significance to be declared unless a p-value >0.05 was obtained.
analysis.p_value_desc: A 0.05 level of significance without adjustment for multiplicity.
analysis.method_desc: Model to include the main effects of treatment and pooled center.

analysis.groups_desc: Week 24. Statistical testing to be 2-sided and use a 0.05 level of significance. Confidence intervals to have a 95% confidence level. Statistical significance to be declared unless a p-value >0.05 was obtained.
analysis.p_value_desc: A 0.05 level of significance without adjustment for multiplicity.
analysis.method_desc: Model to include the main effects of treatment and pooled center.

outcome.title: Percentage of Participants With 4-week Point Prevalence of Nonsmoking
outcome.description: Percentage of participants with complete abstinence from cigarette smoking or use of tobacco products for the 4 weeks prior to Week 24 who did not have CO >10 ppm at any visits.
outcome.population: FAS. Missing inventory interview questions of whether the subject had "smoked or used any other tobacco products" in the last 4 weeks were not imputed. Missing CO was imputed as =<10 ppm.

group.title: Varenicline
group.description: Varenicline 0.5 mg administered QD for the first 3 days followed by 0.5 mg varenicline BID for the next 4 days, then 1 mg varenicline BID for the remaining 11 weeks (treatment phase). Blinded study drug was discontinued at the Week 12 visit and was followed by a non-treatment phase to Week 24.

measure.title: Percentage of Participants With 4-week Point Prevalence of Nonsmoking
measure.description: Percentage of participants with complete abstinence from cigarette smoking or use of tobacco products for the 4 weeks prior to Week 24 who did not have CO >10 ppm at any visits.
measure.population: FAS. Missing inventory interview questions of whether the subject had "smoked or used any other tobacco products" in the last 4 weeks were not imputed. Missing CO was imputed as =<10 ppm.

analysis.groups_desc: Statistical testing to be 2-sided and use a 0.05 level of significance. Confidence intervals to have a 95% confidence level. Statistical significance to be declared unless a p-value >0.05 was obtained.
analysis.p_value_desc: A 0.05 level of significance without adjustment for multiplicity.
analysis.method_desc: Model to include the main effects of treatment and pooled center.

outcome.title: Change From Baseline in Fagerstr√∂m Test for Nicotine Dependence (FTND) to Day of First Quit Attempt (FQA) Through Week 5 by Smoking Status at Weeks 9-12
outcome.description: Change in nicotine dependence from baseline to the date of the FQA within the first 5 weeks. FTND was designed to provide an ordinal measure of nicotine dependence related to cigarette smoking. It contains items that evaluate the quantity of cigarette consumption, the compulsion to use, and dependence. The FTND contains 4 yes-no and 2 multiple choice questions and can be used in a self-report format. The items on FTND are scored 0 to 3 for multiple choice items, the items are summed to yield a total score of 0-10 (0=minimum nicotine dependence; 10=maximum nicotine dependence).
outcome.population: Number of participants analyzed = participants with FQA through Week 5, excluding 157 participants for whom FTND was not done at the time of FQA (1 participant also had inconsistent FQA date with first dosing date). Analysis done by smoking status at Week 12 (Responder for the primary endpoint of CA Weeks 9-12).

group.title: Varenicline
group.description: Varenicline 0.5 mg administered QD for the first 3 days followed by 0.5 mg varenicline BID for the next 4 days, then 1 mg varenicline BID for the remaining 11 weeks (treatment phase). Blinded study drug was discontinued at the Week 12 visit and was followed by a non-treatment phase to Week 24.

measure.title: Change From Baseline in Fagerstr√∂m Test for Nicotine Dependence (FTND) to Day of First Quit Attempt (FQA) Through Week 5 by Smoking Status at Weeks 9-12
measure.description: Change in nicotine dependence from baseline to the date of the FQA within the first 5 weeks. FTND was designed to provide an ordinal measure of nicotine dependence related to cigarette smoking. It contains items that evaluate the quantity of cigarette consumption, the compulsion to use, and dependence. The FTND contains 4 yes-no and 2 multiple choice questions and can be used in a self-report format. The items on FTND are scored 0 to 3 for multiple choice items, the items are summed to yield a total score of 0-10 (0=minimum nicotine dependence; 10=maximum nicotine dependence).
measure.population: Number of participants analyzed = participants with FQA through Week 5, excluding 157 participants for whom FTND was not done at the time of FQA (1 participant also had inconsistent FQA date with first dosing date). Analysis done by smoking status at Week 12 (Responder for the primary endpoint of CA Weeks 9-12).

reported_events.desc: The same event may appear as both an AE and a SAE. However, what is presented are distinct events. An event may be categorized as serious in one subject and as nonserious in another subject, or one subject may have experienced both a serious and nonserious event during the study.

group.title: Varenicline
group.description: Varenicline 0.5 mg administered QD for the first 3 days followed by 0.5 mg varenicline BID for the next 4 days, then 1 mg varenicline BID for the remaining 11 weeks (treatment phase). Blinded study drug was discontinued at the Week 12 visit and was followed by a non-treatment phase to Week 24.

certain_agreements.pi_employee: Principal Investigators are NOT employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: Pfizer has the right to review disclosures, requesting a delay of less than 60 days. Investigator will postpone single center publications until after disclosure of pooled data (all sites), less than 12 months from study completion/termination at all participating sites. Investigator may not disclose previously undisclosed confidential information other than study results.
